intro: Stylidium scabridum, commonly known as the rough-stemmed triggerplant, is a member of the family Haemodoraceae. It is a small, herbaceous plant native to Australia, characterized by its striking red or orange flowers. The plant has hairy, often glandular stems and leaves, which contribute to its distinctive appearance. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils, often in open habitats. The flowers are borne on short, erect stalks and are known for their unique trigger mechanism that aids in pollination.
